definition: direct, winner-takes-all system of election in use for village committees/preselection for a competition
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
surname Hai
to choose/to pick/to select/to elect

sentences.english: Today, the American Idol Audition Road Show made its way to Louisville, Kentucky.
sentences.chinese: 今天，美偶的海选已经到了肯塔基州的路易斯维尔。

sentences.english: A few of us actually entertained the notion of auditioning for American Idol.
sentences.chinese: 我们中心有几小我还考虑过加入美国偶像的海选。

sentences.english: This paper comes out of the field research on "sea election".
sentences.chinese: 本文对这一海选过程作了实证性的资料调查。

sentences.english: A few of us actually entertained the notion of auditioning for American Idol.
sentences.chinese: 我们中间有几个人还考虑过参加美国偶像的海选。

sentences.english: He had barely survived the audition and finally got a chance to advance in the contest.
sentences.chinese: 海选中，他险遭淘汰，但最终赢得晋级的机会。

sentences.english: I think it's the most exciting audition I've ever seen in the show.
sentences.chinese: 这是我在节目中看过最精彩的海选。

sentences.english: He had barely survived the third audition and finally got a chance to advance in the contest.
sentences.chinese: 第三次海选时，他险遭淘汰，但最终赢得晋级的机会。

sentences.english: I have watched this first audition so many times and never get tired of it!
sentences.chinese: 这段海选视频我看了很多次，但从来都看不够。

(sports) semifinal or quarterfinal/to compete in a semifinal (or a quarterfinal)
repechage (supplementary qualifying round in sports)
to select the best
to tussle/to contend/to contest
to take a screen test/to audition/screen test/audition/tryout

talent show
primary election
to exhibit as broadcast/to show (on TV)
referendum/plebiscite
to reveal one's talent (idiom)/to rise above others/to distinguish oneself
joint performance
to sign up/to enter one's name/to apply/to register/to enroll/to enlist
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel
winning/superior
